intro: Bistorta sphaerostachya, commonly known as the spherical bistort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a waxy coating. Its flowers are small and clustered in spherical inflorescences, giving it its common name. Bistorta sphaerostachya is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
